Diagnosis.
Dima pecoudi
is a large species (body length: 13.0– 15.7 mm ), with typical very short, thin and decumbent body pubescence, clinging to the pronotal sides ( Fig. 150 ), very dense pronotal punctation with matt intervals, and elytra matt, with small, dense, fine punctures, with intervals microreticulated ( Figs 85–88 , 171 ). Male genitalia is as in Figs 206–207 .
Dima pelikani
sp. nov.
shares with
D. pecoudi
the similar surface of elytra but differs in the semi-erect pubescence on the sides of pronotum ( Fig. 151 ).

materialsCitation.collectorName: G. Platia & Col de Katara & G. Dubault

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Remark. Two female specimens in the collection of G. Platia ( PCPG ) bear labels " Greece ,
Col de Katara
,
15.V.2000
, G. Dubault leg.". The occurrence of this species near Katara Pass is very improbable and we suppose that these specimens were mislabelled.
